what: Obtain the Module Information from Consensus-Based Investigation — comparePhenotypes
title: Obtain the Module Information from Consensus-Based Investigation — comparePhenotypes
text: Extract module information based consensus results.

title: Obtain the Module Information from Consensus-Based Investigation — comparePhenotypes
code: comparePhenotypes(   C3NAObj_Disease = C3NAObj1,   C3NAObj_Reference = C3NAObj2,   corCutoff = 0.2,   fdr = 0.05,   unusefulTaxa = NA,   verbose = TRUE,   nBootstrap = 300 )

title: Obtain the Module Information from Consensus-Based Investigation — comparePhenotypes
text: C3NAObj_Disease (Required) C3NAObj single phenotype Disease. C3NAObj_Reference (Required) C3NAObj single phenotype Control. corCutoff (Required) positive correlation cut-point, default 0.2. fdr (Required) BH-Adjusted p-value, default 0.05. unusefulTaxa (Optional) list taxa names interpreated, e.g. human_gut, ambiguous_taxa verbose (Optinal) Logical. Return outputs, including suggestion misleading taxa nBootstrap (Optional) Number bootstrap module preservation.

title: Obtain the Module Information from Consensus-Based Investigation — getOptMods
text: C3NAObj (Required) C3NAObj single phenotype initiateC3NA function. selectedPatterns (Required) selected unique patterns identified shiny application. nModules (Required) optimal number clusters identified shiny application.

what: Initiate the C3NA object with Correlation Calculation and Topology Overlap Matrix — initiateC3NA
title: Initiate the C3NA object with Correlation Calculation and Topology Overlap Matrix — initiateC3NA
text: Generate initiate C3NA object, including count matrix, taxonomic table, multi-taxa stacked count matrix C3NA analysis. step also includes sparcc correlation calculation. Note: sparcc correlation can extremely computationally expensive. results summarized along signed network calcualted topology overlap matrix. Finally, different clusters taxa calculated based minimal module size range 3 40 (default).

title: Initiate the C3NA object with Correlation Calculation and Topology Overlap Matrix — initiateC3NA
code: initiateC3NA(   phyloseqObj = phyloseqObj,   prevTrh = 0.1,   nCPUs = 1,   nBootstrap = 1000,   nMinTotalCount = 1000,   phenotype = NA,   minModuleSize = 3,   maxModuleSize = 40,   seed = 100 )

title: Initiate the C3NA object with Correlation Calculation and Topology Overlap Matrix — initiateC3NA
text: phyloseqObj (Required) Phyloseq phyloseq object. first undergo validatePhyloseq ensure diagnosis column present. prevTrh (Required) Prevalence threshold samples, number 0 1. E.g., default 0.1 represents 10% samples need given taxa. nCPUs (Optional) Parallel computation sparccboot function. Default: 1. nBootstrap (Required) Number bootstrap sparcc command. Warning: computational step. nMinTotalCount (Required) Minimal number reads per sample. Default: 1,000. phenotype (Required) desired phenotype present diagnosis column metadata phyloseqObj minModuleSize (Optional) lowest number minimal size cluster. Default: 3. maxModuleSize (Optional) highest number minimal size cluster. Default: 40. seed (Optional)

title: Initiate the C3NA object with Correlation Calculation and Topology Overlap Matrix — initiateC3NA
text: list object C3NA Objects

title: Initiate the C3NA object with Correlation Calculation and Topology Overlap Matrix — initiateC3NA
code: data(CRC_Phyloseq) curPhyloseq = validatePhloseq(phyloseqObj = CRC_Phyloseq)  # These steps are commented out due to time consuming step. The post sparcc correlation data will be  # to avoid the step phyloseq_Normal = phyloseq::subset_samples(physeq = CRC_Phyloseq, diagnosis == "Normal") # C3NAObj_Normal = initiateC3NA(phyloseqObj = phyloseq_Normal, prevTrh = 0.1,  #                               nCPUs = 10, nBootstrap = 1000,  #                               nMinTotalCount = 1000, phenotype = "Normal",  #                               seed = 100)  phyloseq_Cancer = phyloseq::subset_samples(physeq = CRC_Phyloseq, diagnosis == "Cancer") # C3NAObj_Cancer = initiateC3NA(phyloseqObj = phyloseq_Cancer, prevTrh = 0.1,  #                               nCPUs = 10, nBootstrap = 1000,  #                               nMinTotalCount = 1000, phenotype = "Cancer",  #                               seed = 100)

what: Shiny Application for Optimal Module Evaluations — moduleEvals
title: Shiny Application for Optimal Module Evaluations — moduleEvals
text: Shiny application includes two panels. first panel, user can conduct step--step investigation consensus-based module selection, results summarized R command user copies pastes R console. second panel includes download window extracting module pattern, silhouette plot, consensus, correlation plots.

title: Shiny Application for Optimal Module Evaluations — moduleEvals
Shiny Application for Optimal Module Evaluations — moduleEvals
text: C3NAObj (Required) C3NAObj single phenotype initiateC3NA function. colorSeed (Optional) seed set reproducible random colors bar plot fill. Default: 9.

what: Verify Phyloseq Objects before Running the C3NA Pipeline — validatePhloseq
title: Verify Phyloseq Objects before Running the C3NA Pipeline — validatePhloseq
text: validation serve ensure data prepared ready C3NA. Ensure OTUs/ASVs table, Taxa table sample data diagnosis column present. user can provide correct diagnosis column required C3NA phenotype data processing.

title: Verify Phyloseq Objects before Running the C3NA Pipeline — validatePhloseq
Verify Phyloseq Objects before Running the C3NA Pipeline — validatePhloseq
text: phyloseqObj (Required) phyloseq object. diagColName (Optional) Identify dianogis/phenotype column, create 'diagnosis' column column named differently.

title: Verify Phyloseq Objects before Running the C3NA Pipeline — validatePhloseq
text: phyloseq object

title: Verify Phyloseq Objects before Running the C3NA Pipeline — validatePhloseq
